description: From Middle English vicious, from Anglo-Norman vicious, (modern French vicieux), from Latin vitiōsus, from vitium (“fault, vice”). Equivalent to vice +‎ -ous.

adjectives.description: vicious (comparative viciouser or more vicious, superlative viciousest or most vicious)

entries.meaning: (archaic) Pertaining to vice; characterised by immorality or depravity.
examples: We may so seize on vertue, that if we embrace it with an over-greedy and violent desire, it may become vicious.
